title: Tourists in Sardinia told to ditch Google Maps after dozens get lost on quests for idyllic beaches
text:
Tourists exploring the back roads of Sardinia have been urged not to rely on Google Maps after dozens of incidents in which hapless visitors were directed down rough dirt tracks in search of the perfect beach.

Exasperated local authorities have resorted to putting up signs, expressly warning tourists not to use the direction-finding app because it tends to take people down corrugated tracks that are accessible only on foot or by four-wheel-drive.

Ordinary vehicles either get stuck, with drivers having to plead for help from local shepherds, or are forced to make hair-raising U-turns amid the scrub and juniper bushes.

The warnings have been issued by the town of Baunei on Sardinia’s east coast, which says motorists come a cropper when they try to drive to beaches in the area, such as the stunning Cala Luna (Moon Bay) and Cala Goloritze.
